‚û°Ô∏è Allows remote voting by proxy during the COVID-19 pandemic, as implemented last year with slight modifications.

‚û°Ô∏è Mandates that Members & staff can‚Äôt spread manipulated media intending to mislead the public, protects whistleblowers from intimidation or retaliation by Members & staff, and prohibits Members & staff from improper whistleblower identification with limited exceptions.

‚û°Ô∏è Reaffirms subpoena authority by clarifying that current and former presidents and vice-presidents and any current or former White House employees can be subpoenaed. This ensures investigations from the 116th can continue through the new Congress.
‚û°Ô∏è Removes floor privileges from former Members who were convicted of crimes relating to their time in office. This holds legislators to account after they leave their position in Congress.

The House passes new rules every Congress to establish legislative processes of the body for the next two years.

I hear them, and understand their perspective, but this is first and foremost a matter of conscience.

I don't have the authority to overturn the will of other states on behalf of ND, nor do other members have the ability to overturn the will of my state.

They created the Electoral College ‚Äì and gave state legislatures the authority to decide how electors are chosen ‚Äì to ensure small states like North Dakota have a voice at the national level that cannot be silenced by large states.

I share the concerns of my colleagues and the countless North Dakotans who have reached out about the election.

@ElephantEating One of many reasons why climate policy is more effective when it creates LT private-sector contracts than it is when it depends on federal tax policy.  Undoing private contracts is legally much harder than changing the tax code.

@ElephantEating Since most renewables have zero marginal opex, once they are built the REC price doesn't meaningfully impact dispatch so the operative function of tax credits or RPS markets should be to incent initial construction.  LT contracts much more effective than ST tax policy.

@ElephantEating You have to consider both the price and contract duration.  Federal tax subsidies have no long-term certainty given political cycles, but the RPS markets encouraged long term contracts.  10 years at $5/MWh brings a lot more new capital forward than 2 years at $15.
